question: How many days does an employee have to submit fingerprints for a background check in Idaho?
expected_answer: Fingerprints must be submitted within 21 days of date of hire.

question: What is the title of IDAPA 16.03.22 in Idaho?
What manual is available from the Idaho Academy of Nutrition & Dietetics for dietary guidance?
What Idaho Code sections authorize the Board of Health and Welfare to adopt rules for residential assisted living facilities?
When must an individual in Idaho have a new criminal history and background check completed?
expected_answer: When the individual's last criminal history and background check was completed more than three (3) years ago.

question: What is the definition of a carrier under Idaho communicable disease rules?
expected_answer: A carrier is a person who can transmit a communicable disease to another person, but may not have symptoms of the disease.

question: What is the purpose of a residential assisted living facility according to Idaho regulations?
expected_answer: To provide choice, dignity, and independence to residents while maintaining a safe, humane, and homelike residential environment.

question: Can an Idaho ALF charge residents for personal furnishings and equipment provided by the facility?
expected_answer: Yes, the facility may charge residents unless paid for by a publicly funded program, and must provide a detailed itemization.

question: What are the complete requirements for assessment frequency and rate changes in Idaho assisted living facilities?
expected_answer: Services or rates impacted by updated assessment must include the assessment tool, the assessor, and the frequency of assessment when the facility uses this assessment to determine rate changes.

question: What are all the references and standards incorporated by reference in Idaho IDAPA 16.03.22 for residential assisted living facilities?
expected_answer: Idaho Diet Manual, Idaho Food Code (IDAPA 16.02.19), Americans with Disabilities Act Accessibility Guidelines (28 CFR Part 36), and other referenced standards.
